intro: Reseda armena, commonly known as Armenian knotgrass, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Mediterranean and parts of Asia. It is a member of the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes other plants such as carnations and sweet William. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, pink to purple in color, and appear in clusters at the ends of the stems. Reseda armena is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in sunny, well-drained environments.
